questions.content: Julia wants to determine which brand of fertilizer is best for producing tomatoes. She uses three different brands of fertilizer on three separate groups of tomato plants, as well as a group of plants  that will receive no fertilizer. Julia uses cherry tomatoes for her plants. She makes sure to place them in a window sill where they all receive equal amounts of sunlight. The amount of water, the type of soil, and the temperature are kept the same for all of the plants. Over a period of eight weeks, she measures the amount and tomatoes produced by each group. What is the dependent variable in Juliaâ€™s experiment?
candidates: The group that received no fertilizer
The amount of sunlight the plants receive

questions.content: Why is the brand of fertilizer considered the independent variable in this experiment?
questions.answer: Because it is the factor that Julia is changing
candidates: Because it does not influence the outcome
Because it is the factor that Julia is changing
Because it remains constant throughout the study
Because it is measured after the health of the plants
